section.title: Introduction
section.para: This chapter covers the things you need to do when you are using Bugzilla for entering new bugs into the system, and fixing/updating outstanding bugs.
It's assume you have already logged into Bugzilla before doing anything outlined in the following sections.

listitem.para: Go to the bug you want to update.
Add your additional information in the Additional Comments text field.
As the last step, click on the Commit button to commit your changes to the database. A log of this will be sent to the blfs-book mailinglist.

section.title: Enter a new bug
section.para: You found a bug, or somebody else found a bug and you decided to add it to Bugzilla.

listitem.para: Select the proper Version. You most always will choose the CVS version. (Note: SVN will be added to the options. Use that if you see it.) The other versions are basically there only for people who don't edit the book and who want to report a bug against the book version they have.
Don't worry about Platform, OS, and Severity. Those aren't used at the moment.

Select the Priority. Use your own judgement on how important fixing this bug is. If you're not sure just leave the default. Priorities are periodically re-evaluated and changed anyways (what may be P5 a month ago may be changed to a P1 now because it's finally time to fix it).
P1—Critical issue that prevents build a system by the book and must be fixed as soon as possible. Includes package updates that fix serious security holes or fix some other critical bug.
P2—Major issue but not critical in the sense you cannot build an application with it. This includes most package updates. Must be fixed before the next release.
P3—Minor issue that would be nice to have fixed in the next release.
P4—Textual changes that have no impact on the installation instructions.
P5—A new, unclassified and/or unconfirmed bug.
Select the Initial state. Only select UNCONFIRMED if you haven't checked the matter out yet and are only suspecting a bug. Otherwise, leave it as NEW
If you don't want to assign yourself to it right away, leave the Assigned To field blank. It'll be assigned to blfs-book@linuxfromscratch.org then, until a real editor changes that to himself.
Fill in the other fields as appropriate, Summary and Description are mandatory.
As the last step, click on the Commit button to commit your changes to the database. A log of this will be sent to the blfs-book mailinglist.
